intro: Anettea, commonly known as the redstem dogwood, is a deciduous shrub native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Cornaceae and is characterized by its showy, white or pink flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that turn red in the fall, adding to its ornamental value. Anettea typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. It is often used in landscaping for its aesthetic appeal and ecological benefits.
